articles.title: When was Paper Currency Introduced in Nigeria?
articles.author: Davies Ngere Ify
articles.summary: The introduction of paper money in Nigeria marked a significant milestone in the country's economic development. Before the arrival of European colonizers, Nigerians used various forms of currency, including cowrie shells and metal coins. In 1912, the West African Currency Board introduced the British West African pound. On July 1, 1959, the Central Bank of Nigeria introduced the first paper notes, denominated in Nigerian pounds, shillings, and pence. On January 1, 1973, the Nigerian government replaced the pound with the naira. Since then, the CBN has introduced various denominations and designs to meet the changing economic needs of Nigeria.
